data: For smooth muscle antispasmodic agent in Medical Imaging for patients having CT and MRI studies of the abdomen and pelvis

Contraindications:
A prior history of allergic reaction to Hyoscine BUTYLbromide and unstable cardiac disease is considered a relative contraindication to receive this medication in the future
Consultation between clinical teams may be required to evaluate risk-benefit ratio prior to administering Hyoscine BUTYLbromide in pregnant patients
When discharge criteria met. For outpatients only

In the rare event that painful, blurred vision develops in one or both eyes after discharge, instruct patient to seek medical 
attention immediately to the nearest emergency department
20 gauge, antecubital fossa for IV  Hyoscine BUTYLbromide (Busocopan) administration only
Discontinue order set when post CT or MRI studies of the abdoment and pelivis monitoring complete
NPO, Minimum of 4 hours prior to scheduled exam
20 mg, IV direct, once, drug form: inj
20 mg, IM, once, drug form: inj
